programme.title: The Football Academy
programme.desc: Series following the young boys, girls and para-players at Southampton Academy.

programme.title: One Zoo Three
programme.desc: Documentary series following the daily operations at Hertfordshire's Paradise Wildlife Park, a family zoo run by brothers Cam, Tyler and Aaron Whitnall. With over 800 exotic animals for the workforce to take care of, the days can be long and challenging, though the brothers wouldn't have it any other way. Made for CBBC, the series gives young viewers the chance to meet the zoo's collection of fascinating animals and follow the brothers as they perform tasks that are both enjoyable, such as playing with the animals, and unenjoyable, such as cleaning out their toilets!

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: News and current affairs programme for children and teens. With details of the day's events, the latest developments and the biggest national and international stories. Newsround looks at the world's main news and provides insight that is aimed at a younger audience. With a special focus on issues affecting young people.

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.sub-title: Exploring Our New Garden and Adventures at Sea
programme.desc: The finishing touches are applied to a new Blue Peter garden.

programme.title: Deadly Predators
programme.desc: A series dedicated to investigating the aquatic predators and showcasing close underwater encounters.

programme.title: Celebrity Best Home Cook
programme.desc: Celebrity Best Home Cook show presented by Claudia Winkleman features 10 famous faces from sport, TV and comedy who compete to impress judges Mary Berry, Angela Hartnett and Chris Bavin. The contestants may be the best in their own sphere, but one thing that interests the judges is if their cooking skills are good enough. The winner will be crowned Celebrity Best Home Cook.

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Natural World, cette série documentaire, d'origine britannique, compte presque 500 épisodes sur la nature, les animaux, la faune et l'environnement. Découvrez le pouvoir de la nature et de notre planète.

programme.title: Rugby : Tournoi des Six Nations féminin

programme.title: Carole King - Home Again: Live at Central Park
Carole King - Natural Woman
programme.desc: The King and HM the Queen's other children holding vigil around the coffin of Her Majesty.

programme.title: Pilgrimage: The Road to Santiago
programme.desc: Seven celebrities accept a challenge and go on pilgrimage in order to promote tolerance for all faiths and cultures on earth. The brave team set out on the famous Camino de Santiago pilgrimage. To cover this ancient 780km path across northern Spain to the Cathedral of Santiago de Compostela and the shrine of St James they have only 15 days. Actor Neil Morrissey, entertainer Debbie McGee, comedian Ed Byrne, singer Heather Small, priest Kate Bottley, journalist Raphael Rowe and TV presenter JJ Chalmers explore whether a medieval pilgrimage has any relevance in the modern day.
